question_text: You are installing a new modular power supply into a high-end workstation. After powering on, the system does not boot and there is no fan spin on the GPU. Which of the following is the MOST likely issue?
answer_options: The 24-pin motherboard connector is incompatible with the chipset
The SATA power cable is not compatible with modular design
You connected the modular PCIe power cable into a CPU power socket
The system requires a dual-rail power supply
correct_answer: You connected the modular PCIe power cable into a CPU power socket
explanation: On modular PSUs, connectors may look identical, but pinouts differ between CPU and PCIe power. Misconnecting them can prevent power delivery to the GPU and damage components.
